ad7e25107704cb85b75f6a1ecaeaede5 (09:44): is it like an included file?

62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (09:45): Well, this describes how it can be used by the UA: http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/global.html#profiles

ad7e25107704cb85b75f6a1ecaeaede5 (09:47): like the part that might be common to all your sites pages
62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (09:47): Well, if it's internally-used you can choose any format to use on the profile file

62fba5811243f518935848d952809f8c (09:47): Fr0zen_: The word is "ampersand". The character is "&". The entity is "&amp;".

cf1e180d2cc871c714d49cd124c396cb (10:19): I have a question.. I see alot of sites where each page appears as if they are their own "folder"... (there's no extension).. i was wondering is that really the case about these sites, do they have folders for each page?
72497cdf35324734fbd28572c5be08d3 (10:20): possible, but more likely they rewrite the url on the server using something like mod_rewrite
cf1e180d2cc871c714d49cd124c396cb (10:20): ok ill check that out thanks!
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (10:20): definetly, i use it on my site
bae4f3944ed80aac1111427c1efb8f2f (10:20): it would be a bitch makin folders lol
